column4: Hey guys, I am a VERY experienced linux usser, but just ran into something I have never seen in my 12+ years of using Linux.  Installed on a desktop I had recently acquired, grub is out of range for the monitor, therefore I cannot see it. It does load fine, if I just hit enter when the creen shuts off, the kernel loads.  If I press down arrow a bunch of times, then enter, it will load windows.
I wasnt aware grub even had display settings.  How can I set it for my monitor so it will be in range?
i had that problem like 10 years ago when i installed redhat on a faulty hdd pentium 1 mmx
it has nothing to do with hardware being faulty
